fields.descriptive_line: Trade catalogue, Pedigree Dolls, International Model Aircraft Limited, a subsidiary of Lines Bros. Ltd., printed paper; English, 1963
fields.physical_description: A 40-page (including front and back covers) catalogue with photographs and descriptions of the Pedigree Dolls Limited range of dolls, soft toys and playthings. The majority of photographs are black and white, although some are printed in colour. The products described consist of dolls, jointed teddy bears, washable soft toys, wheeled soft toys and chassis toys for children to ride on, pull-alongs, vinyl squeakers, bath toys and novelty toys. The front cover consists of a colour photograph of scene of house and garden with dolls and soft toys posed within it, including a lamb, rabbit and puppy on the grass in the forground, and a Golly pulling a horse and cart containing 2 waving dolls behind, with 1 further doll standing next to the cart. The back cover is a similar scene with different products. Inside the front cover is a list of contents as well as a letter to toy retailers from D.G. Bibby, Managing Director, about the range, and the fact that they have been produced for the first time by the new company Pedigree Dolls Limited,  formed on 1st January 1964.
fields.title: Pedigree Dolls
fields.marks:
'Pedigree / Regd. Trade Mark' in white text in an orange box in the top left corner of the front and back covers.
 'Pedigree Dolls / Regd Trade Mark' in white text on back cover.
 A large 'L' in black in a white triangle within a black triangle containing the text, in white, 'LINES / BROS / GROUP' around the circumference.
fields.public_access_description: This catalogue is one item from a collection given to the Museum by Dennis Arkinstall, who worked in the toy industry as a toy designer for Lines Bros. Ltd., and who would have worked on many of the products shown in it. Lines Bros. produced a wide range of toys, and were famous for their Tri-ang range. In the 1960's they one of the largest toy manufacturers in the world, and owned many subsidiary companies, including Pedigree Dolls Limited, which was formed on the 1st January 1964. This catalogue is the first to be produced by the this company. Previously, the range had been produced by International Model Aircraft Limited, another Lines Bros. subsidiary (although in effect it was only the name of the company that changed, as the range was produced in the same factory as before). This 40-page catalogue contains photographs and descriptive text on the whole Pedigree range of dolls, soft toys and playthings for 1964. It was sent to toy retailers, rather than the general public, to advertise the range, which includes dolls, jointed teddy bears, washable soft toys, wheeled soft toys and chassis toys for children to ride on, pull-alongs, vinyl squeakers, bath toys and novelty toys.
fields.history_note: This catalogue belonged to Dennis Arkinstall, who worked for Lines Bros. Ltd. as a sculptor. It was given to the Museum by his son soon after his death. It was produced by the then newly-formed Pedigree Dolls Limited., a subsidiary company of the Lines Bros. Group, to advertise their range of dolls and soft toys. The range had previously been manufactured by International Model Aircraft Limited, another Lines Bros. subsidiary, and this catalogue is the first produced by the new company, which came into being on 1st January 1964.
fields.production_note: Produced by Pedigree Dolls Limited, a subsidiary company of Lines Bros. Ltd.
fields.historical_context_note: This catalogue was sent to the toy retailers rather than the general public.
